title: Public transport for the A-League Round 20 – Melbourne Victory v Melbourne City: Saturday, 22 February 2025
articleContent:
A-League continues at AAMI Park as Melbourne Victory takes on Melbourne City in another Melbourne derby.

Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action and we're running extra services to help you get home from AAMI Park on Saturday 22 February.

Kick-off is at 7:35 pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Note: Buses replace trains on the Hurstbridge Line between Heidelberg and Eltham during this time.

 Metropolitan train

Return trains from Richmond Station

  • Ringwood - leaving at 09:58pm and 10:08pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley - leaving at 9:54pm and 10:06 pm from Platform 10
  • Dandenong - leaving at 09:53pm and 10:03pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston - leaving at 09:54pm and 10:14 from Platform 4
  • Sandringham - leaving at 09:54pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Catch a Route 70 tram from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Melbourne Showgrounds

Catch a Route 246 bus close to AAMI Park.

 Regional train

Normal trains leave from Southern Cross Station
